title: Introduction
paragraphs: The Hubble API lets you view and manage data like accounts, subscriptions, invoices, transactions, and plans.

The Hubble API is basically a REST API. It has predictable resource-oriented URLs, accepts form-encoded request bodies, returns JSON-encoded responses, and uses standard HTTP response codes, authentication, and verbs.

title: Authentication
paragraphs: The Hubble API uses API keys to authenticate requests. It uses bearer authentication for its HTTP authentication scheme. You can view and manage your API keys in the Hubble Console.
API keys provide access to senstivie information. Therefore, be sure to keep them secure! Do not share your API keys in places such as GitHub, client-side code, and so on.
All API requests must be made over HTTPS. Calls made over plain HTTP will fail. API requests without authentication will also fail.
